page.title: 06Our School 1.
page.content: When he died in 1714 Richard Elsworth of Bickham left money to establish a school here.Today the Elsworth Trust is responsible for the maintenance of the outer fabric of the school.There is an annual allocation to cover this and various other items of educational value.The catchment area covers Timberscombe,Luccombe and Wootton Courtenay both the latter villages having lost their schools in1946 and 1947 respectively.Today there are 25 children in the school,13 Timberscombe 5 from Luccombe and 7 from Wootton.In Nov.1984,the decision was taken by Somerset to review the schools future The support from parents and the comm- unity was overwhelming as an organisa- tion was set up to campaign against closure. They were successful. When the vote was taken in Feb.1985 the decision not to close was unanimous.
